Administration.text:
Type: Alcohol dehydrogenase inhibitor,
antidote
Routes of Administration: Intravenous
Common Trade Names: Antizol

Adult_Dosing.text:
Loading: 15 mg/kg
Maintenance: 10 mg/kg every 12 hours

Pediatric_Dosing.text:
Loading: 15 mg/kg
Maintenance: 10 mg/kg every 12 hours

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk
: Unknown if excreted in breast mild

Hemodialysis_Dosing.text: For patients undergoing hemodialysis for complications associated with toxic alcohol ingestion, dosing should be adjusted in consultation with a nephrologist.

Hepatic_Dosing.text: Fomepizole is metabolized in the liver, specific dosing adjustments for hepatic impairment have not been developed.

Hemodialysis_Dosing.text: For patients undergoing hemodialysis for complications associated with toxic alcohol ingestion, dosing should be adjusted in consultation with a nephrologist.

Hepatic_Dosing.text: Fomepizole is metabolized in the liver, specific dosing adjustments for hepatic impairment have not been developed.
Fomepizole is metabolized in the liver, specific dosing adjustments for hepatic impairment have not been developed.

Serious.text:
Bradycardia
Hypotension
Shock
Anemia
Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC)

Bradycardia
Hypotension
Shock
Anemia
Disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC)

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: Not calculated
Metabolism: Hepatic
Excretion: Urine
